glsa.title: libotr: Arbitrary code execution
glsa.synopsis: A buffer overflow vulnerability in libotr could allow a remote attacker to execute arbitrary code or cause a Denial of Service condition.

background.p: libotr is a portable off-the-record messaging library.

description.p: Multiple heap-based buffer overflows are present in the Base64 decoder of libotr.

impact.p: A remote attacker could send a specially crafted OTR message, resulting in arbitrary code execution with the privileges of the process or a Denial of Service condition.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All libotr users should upgrade to the latest version:
